title: Agile Tour Vienna 2023
text:
Vienna’s leading agile community conference
about.
The Agile Tour Vienna has always tried to find the perfect balance between international experts on Agile, practitioners from the local community, and anyone else interested in incorporating agile values and principles in their daily work.
The Agile Tour Vienna is an on-site conference run by the agile community in Austria. Please note, as we are a non-profit event, we cannot cover travel costs.
This year’s conference will be a very special one. We have explicitly decided against holding an online conference and instead want to focus on the community and personal exchange aspects of the tour.
Look forward to a relaxed atmosphere in the open air with interesting talks, meeting old friends and making new ones, a barbecue and of course good coffee. 🙂 And don’t worry, we have contingency plans for bad weather!

How did Agile Tour Vienna evolve?
We have kept an archive of videos and presentations from more then 10 years.
tickets.
Tickets are sold out!
call for proposals.
Submissions are closed.
We’re interested in all your agile experiences, though we have picked out 5 themes that we think could be particularly interesting. Please indicate in your submission, which theme is most appropriate. If your talk doesn’t fit one of those themes – no excuse, here’s a catch-all category for everything else! We reserve the right to move your topic to another track if we feel it is more appropriate.
Topic 1: Agile Games
Let’s play! Agile games are a great way to make agile concepts alife and tangible and speed up learning. Bring in your coolest games.
Will ChatGPT replace my Scrum Master? Can AI support us in focusing on the most important information? Or will it add to the information overload where we don’t even know what is true or fake?
How do you think that AI will influence our Agile way of working? What benefit can it bring to the teams? What risks do you see?
All you need to know regarding the Call for Proposals and the Young Talent format can be found in this PDF:
Submit your proposal by:
